text: My name is Chouaieb Nemri.
I am a Machine Learning Data Lab Solutions Architect.
I am based in Toulouse, in the southwest of France.
I have not had, let's say, a regular childhood.
I was not able to play games like hide and seek or soccer.
I got access to my first electric wheelchair at this age of six years old.
I have learned since my early childhood,

that technology can have
a very positive impact on our lives.

And that sparked my interest
in studying STEM
since high school,
and that's how I got into technology.

So before moving to the cloud,
I spent three years
designing cars, designing high-voltage systems.
Working in IT in general is, by design, adapted for people like myself.
With a good internet connection and a laptop,
you can basically work with global teams and have impact.

So I was amazed by the power of the cloud,
the opportunity that it brings.

I was also intimidated, intimidated
by the huge amount of knowledge
that you need to know in order to navigate the world of cloud,
I was quite new to all that stuff.
I have identified the AWS Solution Architect as the first certification
to start with because it really covers the breadth of IT

knowledge that you need to 
have when you work in the data business.

The reason why I identified a AWS
Certified Solutions Architect Associate,
as a fit for me,

was the fact that I was already coming
from STEM,

and I felt confident that I had enough background
to start with that certification.
Now I have 10 AWS certifications.

I have recently discovered AWS Skill Builder,
and it has valuable resources
for learners and builders who would like to dive deeper into AWS.
What I have found particularly useful is the exam prep courses,
because they quickly help you make sure that you are
are good to go, to book your exam and sit for it.

Cloud is becoming, today, a fundamental
skill for everyone who is working in IT.

I think by having this opportunity of
learning and diving deeper in the cloud
and getting certified, that accelerated my career.
After having a bunch of AWS certification, I was able
to almost more than double my salary.

Because companies give a lot of importance
to these certifications, and they trust
the fact that you are able to deliver on behalf of their customers.
Working in IT is very empowering,

I felt successful and happy
with what I am doing

and I wanted to offer the same opportunity
to people belonging to my community.
In my free time, I provide guidance,
mentoring to people with disabilities.

The biggest legacy
that I can give to my kids,

itâ€™s going to be a world that is more diverse,
more accepting, and more equitable.
